birth_place.zh-cn: 大清安徽省安庆府怀宁县十里铺
birth_place.en: Shilipu, Huaining County, Anqing Prefecture, Anhui Province, Qing dynasty

death_place.zh-cn: 中华民国四川省江津县
death_place.en: Jiangjin County, Sichuan Province, Republic of China

description.zh-cn: 中国近现代思想家、政治家、革命家，新文化运动的主要开创人和领袖之一，中国共产党主要创始人及初期领袖。
description.en: A Chinese modern thinker, politician, and revolutionary. He was one of the main initiators and leaders of the New Culture Movement, and a principal founder and early leader of the Chinese Communist Party.

description.zh-cn: 由陈独秀创办的月刊，是新文化运动开始的标志和主要阵地。
description.en: A monthly magazine founded by Chen Duxiu, which marked the beginning and served as the main platform for the New Culture Movement.

description.zh-cn: 20世纪初由陈独秀、胡适、蔡元培等人发起的思想文化革新运动，提倡民主与科学。
description.en: An intellectual and cultural reform movement in the early 20th century initiated by figures like Chen Duxiu, Hu Shih, and Cai Yuanpei, advocating for democracy and science.

description.zh-cn: 中国的执政党，由陈独秀、李大钊等人于1921年创立。
description.en: The ruling political party of China, founded in 1921 by figures including Chen Duxiu and Li Dazhao.

description.zh-cn: 1927年由蒋介石发动的针对共产党员的政治清洗运动，导致第一次国共合作破裂和陈独秀下台。
description.en: A political purge of communists launched by Chiang Kai-shek in 1927, which led to the collapse of the First United Front and the downfall of Chen Duxiu.

description.zh-cn: 一个国际性的共产党组织，深刻影响了早期中国共产党的决策和发展。
description.en: An international communist organization that profoundly influenced the decisions and development of the early Chinese Communist Party.

description.zh-cn: 一种马克思主义理论，由列夫·托洛茨基提出。陈独秀在被开除出中共后接受了此思想。
description.en: A Marxist theory developed by Leon Trotsky. Chen Duxiu embraced this ideology after being expelled from the CCP.

nodes.id: 中国共产党左派反对派

zh-cn: 中国共产党左派反对派
en: Left Opposition of the Chinese Communist Party

description.zh-cn: 由陈独秀于1931年建立的中国托洛茨基主义组织。
description.en: A Chinese Trotskyist organization established by Chen Duxiu in 1931.

description.zh-cn: 中国的政党，曾在1928年至1949年间统治中国大陆。陈独秀曾于1932年被其政府逮捕判刑。
description.en: A Chinese political party that ruled mainland China from 1928 to 1949. Its government arrested and sentenced Chen Duxiu in 1932.

description.zh-cn: 中国抵抗日本侵略的战争，其爆发促成了陈独秀于1937年提前出狱。
description.en: The war of Chinese resistance against Japanese invasion, the outbreak of which led to Chen Duxiu's early release from prison in 1937.

description.zh-cn: 苏联领导人，其对共产国际的领导及相关政策被陈独秀认为是导致1927年中国大革命失败的重要原因。
description.en: Leader of the Soviet Union, whose leadership of the Comintern and related policies were considered by Chen Duxiu to be a major cause of the failure of the 1927 Chinese revolution.

description.zh-cn: 中国教育家，曾任北京大学校长。他聘请陈独秀为文科学长，是新文化运动的重要领导者之一。
description.en: A Chinese educator and former president of Peking University. He appointed Chen Duxiu as Dean of the School of Letters and was a key leader of the New Culture Movement.

description.zh-cn: 中国哲学家、文学家，新文化运动的领袖之一。他与陈独秀在新文化运动期间是亲密战友，后因政治理念不同而产生分歧。
description.en: A Chinese philosopher and writer, and a leader of the New Culture Movement. He was a close ally of Chen Duxiu during the New Culture Movement but later diverged due to different political ideologies.

description.zh-cn: 中国共产党和中华人民共和国的主要缔造者。他承认早年深受陈独秀和《新青年》的影响，并称陈为“五四运动时期的总司令”。
description.en: The main founder of the Chinese Communist Party and the People's Republic of China. He acknowledged being deeply influenced by Chen Duxiu and 'New Youth' in his early years, and called Chen the 'commander-in-chief of the May Fourth Movement'.

description.zh-cn: 1919年发生于北京的一场以青年学生为主的爱国运动，陈独秀被认为是该运动的实际领导者。
description.en: A patriotic movement in Beijing in 1919, primarily led by young students, of which Chen Duxiu is considered the de facto leader.

description.zh-cn: 中国著名高等学府，新文化运动的主要阵地。陈独秀曾在此担任文科学长。
description.en: A renowned institution of higher learning in China and a major center of the New Culture Movement. Chen Duxiu served as the Dean of its School of Letters.

description.zh-cn: 中国共产党主要创始人之一，与陈独秀一同创立了中国共产党。
description.en: One of the main founders of the Chinese Communist Party, who co-founded the party with Chen Duxiu.

description.zh-cn: 共产国际远东局代表，他与陈独秀的会面直接推动了中国共产党的创建。
description.en: A representative of the Comintern's Far Eastern Bureau, whose meeting with Chen Duxiu directly spurred the creation of the Chinese Communist Party.

description.zh-cn: 中国共产党的早期组织之一，由陈独秀、李汉俊等人在上海建立。
description.en: An early organization of the Chinese Communist Party, established in Shanghai by Chen Duxiu, Li Hanjun, and others.

description.zh-cn: 中国国民党领袖。1927年，他发动的“清党”运动导致第一次国共合作破裂，并直接造成陈独秀政治生涯的转折。
description.en: Leader of the Kuomintang. In 1927, the 'party purge' he launched led to the breakdown of the First United Front and was a direct turning point in Chen Duxiu's political career.

description.zh-cn: 国民党左派领袖。在四一二政变后曾与陈独秀发表联合宣言，但不久后便发动七一五事变与共产党决裂。
description.en: Leader of the left wing of the Kuomintang. He issued a joint declaration with Chen Duxiu after the April 12 Purge, but soon launched the July 15 Incident to break with the communists.

description.zh-cn: 由陈独秀、彭述之等人创建的中国早期托洛茨基主义组织。
description.en: An early Chinese Trotskyist organization founded by Chen Duxiu, Peng Shuzhi, and others.

description.zh-cn: 中国学者、政治活动家。他曾与陈独秀合作办刊，并在陈独秀被国民党政府审判时为其出庭辩护。
description.en: A Chinese scholar and political activist. He collaborated with Chen Duxiu on publications and defended him in court when Chen was tried by the Kuomintang government.

description.zh-cn: 中国共产党早期领导人。1938年，他与康生等人领导了对陈独秀的抹黑攻击，指控其为“汉奸”。
description.en: An early leader of the Chinese Communist Party. In 1938, he, along with Kang Sheng and others, led the smear campaign against Chen Duxiu, accusing him of being a 'traitor'.

description.zh-cn: 中国共产党领导人。1938年，他与王明等人领导了对陈独秀的抹黑攻击，指控其为“汉奸”。
description.en: A leader of the Chinese Communist Party. In 1938, he, along with Wang Ming and others, led the smear campaign against Chen Duxiu, accusing him of being a 'traitor'.

description.zh-cn: 陈独秀的原配妻子。
description.en: Chen Duxiu's first wife.

description.zh-cn: 陈独秀的第二任妻子，高晓岚的妹妹。
description.en: Chen Duxiu's second wife, sister of Gao Xiaolan.

description.zh-cn: 陈独秀的第三任妻子（伴侣）。
description.en: Chen Duxiu's third wife (partner).

description.zh-cn: 陈独秀长子，中共早期领导人，1927年被国民党杀害。
description.en: Chen Duxiu's eldest son, an early CCP leader, killed by the Kuomintang in 1927.

description.zh-cn: 陈独秀次子，中共早期领导人，1928年被国民党杀害。
description.en: Chen Duxiu's second son, an early CCP leader, executed by the Kuomintang in 1928.

description.zh-cn: 中国现代文学家。陈独秀曾多次催促他在《新青年》上发表小说，对其文学创作起到了重要的推动作用。
description.en: A modern Chinese writer. Chen Duxiu repeatedly urged him to publish novels in 'New Youth', playing a crucial role in promoting his literary creation.

description.zh-cn: 日本东京的一所学校，陈独秀曾于此留学。
description.en: A school in Tokyo, Japan, where Chen Duxiu once studied.

description.zh-cn: 日本东京的一所学校，陈独秀曾于此学习陆军科。
description.en: A school in Tokyo, Japan, where Chen Duxiu studied military science.

description.zh-cn: 日本著名大学，陈独秀曾于此学习。
description.en: A famous university in Japan where Chen Duxiu studied.

description.zh-cn: 位于杭州的书院，陈独秀曾于1897年在此学习。
description.en: An academy in Hangzhou where Chen Duxiu studied in 1897.

description.zh-cn: 1913年国民党发动的反对袁世凯的军事行动，陈独秀曾参与其中。
description.en: A 1913 military campaign launched by the Kuomintang against Yuan Shikai, in which Chen Duxiu participated.

description.zh-cn: 中华民国早期领导人，陈独秀曾参与反对他的“二次革命”。
description.en: An early leader of the Republic of China, whom Chen Duxiu opposed by participating in the 'Second Revolution'.

description.zh-cn: 1915年，陈独秀在上海创办了《青年杂志》（后改名《新青年》），自任总编辑和主要撰稿人。
description.en: In 1915, Chen Duxiu founded 'La Jeunesse' (later renamed 'New Youth') in Shanghai, serving as its chief editor and main contributor.

description.zh-cn: 陈独秀是新文化运动的主要开创人和领袖之一，他创办的《新青年》是该运动的主要阵地。
description.en: Chen Duxiu was one of the main initiators and leaders of the New Culture Movement, and his magazine 'New Youth' was the movement's primary platform.

description.zh-cn: 陈独秀是中国共产党的主要创始人之一，并在1920年开始组建共产主义组织。
description.en: Chen Duxiu was one of the main founders of the Chinese Communist Party, beginning to organize communist groups in 1920.

description.zh-cn: 1927年的国民党清党运动导致中共遭受重大打击，陈独秀因此被共产国际认为负有领导责任而被迫辞职。
description.en: The 1927 Kuomintang purge resulted in significant setbacks for the CCP, leading the Comintern to hold Chen Duxiu responsible and force his resignation.

description.zh-cn: 在1927年国民党清党后，共产国际认为陈独秀对中共遭受的打击负有领导责任，迫使其辞去总书记职务。
description.en: After the 1927 Kuomintang purge, the Comintern held Chen Duxiu responsible for the CCP's setbacks and forced him to resign from his position as General Secretary.

description.zh-cn: 1929年，因陈独秀在中东路事件中持托洛茨基主义立场并反对“武装保卫苏联”的口号，中共中央决议将其开除党籍。
description.en: In 1929, the CCP Central Committee resolved to expel Chen Duxiu from the party due to his Trotskyist stance and opposition to the 'Armed Defense of the Soviet Union' slogan during the Chinese Eastern Railway Incident.

relationships.target: 中国共产党左派反对派

description.zh-cn: 1931年，陈独秀联合中国各托派小组织，建立了统一的托派组织“中国共产党左派反对派”。
description.en: In 1931, Chen Duxiu united various small Trotskyist factions in China to establish the unified Trotskyist organization 'Left Opposition of the Chinese Communist Party'.

description.zh-cn: 1932年，陈独秀被国民党政府逮捕，并以“以文字为叛国之宣传”罪名判刑。
description.en: In 1932, Chen Duxiu was arrested by the Kuomintang government and sentenced on charges of 'treasonous propaganda through writing'.

description.zh-cn: 抗日战争爆发后，陈独秀于1937年被提前释放出狱。
description.en: After the outbreak of the Second Sino-Japanese War, Chen Duxiu was released from prison ahead of schedule in 1937.

description.zh-cn: 1917年，时任北京大学校长的蔡元培聘请陈独秀为文科学长，为新文化运动提供了重要平台。
description.en: In 1917, Cai Yuanpei, then president of Peking University, appointed Chen Duxiu as Dean of the School of Letters, providing a crucial platform for the New Culture Movement.

description.zh-cn: 在新文化运动时期，胡适与陈独秀是亲密的思想战友，共同推动了文学革命和思想启蒙。
description.en: During the New Culture Movement, Hu Shih and Chen Duxiu were close ideological allies, jointly promoting the literary revolution and intellectual enlightenment.

description.zh-cn: 1920年后，随着陈独秀转向马克思列宁主义，他与坚持自由主义的胡适在办刊宗旨和政治理念上产生严重分歧。
description.en: After 1920, as Chen Duxiu turned to Marxism-Leninism, he had serious disagreements with the liberal Hu Shih over the purpose of their publications and political ideologies.

description.zh-cn: 毛泽东自述在青年时期深受陈独秀及其主编的《新青年》杂志的影响，陈独秀的思想对他转向马克思主义起到了关键作用。
description.en: Mao Zedong stated that in his youth, he was deeply influenced by Chen Duxiu and his magazine 'New Youth', and Chen's ideas played a key role in his turn towards Marxism.

description.zh-cn: 陈独秀被毛泽东等人认为是五四运动时期的总司令，他的思想和《新青年》杂志对运动的爆发和发展起到了领导作用。
description.en: Chen Duxiu was regarded by Mao Zedong and others as the commander-in-chief of the May Fourth Movement; his ideas and the 'New Youth' magazine played a leading role in the outbreak and development of the movement.

description.zh-cn: 1920年，共产国际代表维金斯基与陈独秀会面，向其介绍马克思列宁主义，并支持他组建共产主义组织，直接促成了中国共产党的诞生。
description.en: In 1920, Comintern representative Grigori Voitinsky met with Chen Duxiu, introduced him to Marxism-Leninism, and supported his efforts to form a communist organization, directly leading to the birth of the Chinese Communist Party.

description.zh-cn: 1920年8月，陈独秀与李汉俊等人在上海建立了共产主义小组，这是中国共产党的前身。
description.en: In August 1920, Chen Duxiu, along with Li Hanjun and others, established the Shanghai Communist Group, a precursor to the Chinese Communist Party.

description.zh-cn: 1927年，蒋介石发动四一二政变，与共产党决裂，导致陈独秀的政治生涯遭受重挫。
description.en: In 1927, Chiang Kai-shek launched the April 12 Purge, breaking with the Communist Party, which led to a major setback in Chen Duxiu's political career.

description.zh-cn: 1938年，王明与康生等人领导了对陈独秀的攻击运动，在共产党刊物上指控其为“日特汉奸”。
description.en: In 1938, Wang Ming, along with Kang Sheng and others, led a smear campaign against Chen Duxiu, accusing him of being a 'Japanese spy and traitor' in Communist publications.

description.zh-cn: 1938年，康生与王明等人领导了对陈独秀的攻击运动，在共产党刊物上指控其为“日特汉奸”。
description.en: In 1938, Kang Sheng, along with Wang Ming and others, led a smear campaign against Chen Duxiu, accusing him of being a 'Japanese spy and traitor' in Communist publications.

description.zh-cn: 高晓岚是陈独秀的原配妻子，于1897年结婚。
description.en: Gao Xiaolan was Chen Duxiu's first wife, married in 1897.

description.zh-cn: 高君曼是陈独秀的第二任妻子，两人于1909年同居结婚，1925年分居。
description.en: Gao Junman was Chen Duxiu's second wife. They began living together and married in 1909, and separated in 1925.

description.zh-cn: 潘兰珍是陈独秀的第三任妻子（伴侣），两人于1930年结婚。
description.en: Pan Lanzhen was Chen Duxiu's third wife (partner); they married in 1930.

description.zh-cn: 陈延年是陈独秀与高晓岚所生的长子。
description.en: Chen Yannian was the eldest son of Chen Duxiu and Gao Xiaolan.

description.zh-cn: 1927年，陈延年被国民党政府逮捕并杀害。
description.en: In 1927, Chen Yannian was arrested and killed by the Kuomintang government.

description.zh-cn: 陈乔年是陈独秀与高晓岚所生的次子。
description.en: Chen Qiaonian was the second son of Chen Duxiu and Gao Xiaolan.

description.zh-cn: 1928年，陈乔年被国民党政府处决。
description.en: In 1928, Chen Qiaonian was executed by the Kuomintang government.

description.zh-cn: 作为《新青年》的主编，陈独秀多次催促鲁迅进行小说创作，对其成为文学巨匠起到了重要的推动作用。
description.en: As the editor of 'New Youth', Chen Duxiu repeatedly urged Lu Xun to write fiction, playing a significant role in his emergence as a literary giant.

description.zh-cn: 1913年，陈独秀追随柏文蔚参加了反对袁世凯的“二次革命”。
description.en: In 1913, Chen Duxiu followed Bo Wenwei to participate in the 'Second Revolution' against Yuan Shikai.

description.zh-cn: 二次革命是国民党为反对袁世凯独裁而发动的军事行动。
description.en: The Second Revolution was a military campaign launched by the Kuomintang to oppose Yuan Shikai's dictatorship.

position.en: Dean of the School of Letters

description.zh-cn: 陈独秀于1917年1月至1919年6月期间担任北京大学文科学长。
description.en: Chen Duxiu served as the Dean of the School of Letters at Peking University from January 1917 to June 1919.
